entity.name: Browser support
entity.description: Browser support, compatibility, and consistency issues
entity.descriptionClean: Browser support, compatibility, and consistency issues

entity.name: Choice overload
entity.description: Overwhelming amount of options and choices
entity.descriptionClean: Overwhelming amount of options and choices

entity.name: Navigation API
entity.description: Initiate, intercept, and manage navigation actions, examine history entries. Successor to the older `history` and `location` APIs.
entity.descriptionHtml: Initiate, intercept, and manage navigation actions, examine history entries. Successor to the older history and location APIs.
entity.descriptionClean: Initiate, intercept, and manage navigation actions, examine history entries. Successor to the older history and location APIs.

example.codeHighlighted: navigation.navigate(url, {history: "push"}); navigation.addEventListener("navigate", interceptNavigation);

resources.title: The navigation API has moved to the HTML Standard
GitHub - WICG/navigation-api: The new navigation API provides a new interface for navigations and session history, with a focus on single-page application navigations.

entity.name: `Intl.Segmenter` API
entity.description: Language-sensitive segmentation of text into graphemes, words or sentences.
entity.descriptionClean: Language-sensitive segmentation of text into graphemes, words or sentences.

entity.name: Popover API
entity.description: HTML syntax and JS API facilitating popovers such as overlays, popups, menus etc.
entity.descriptionClean: HTML syntax and JS API facilitating popovers such as overlays, popups, menus etc.

example.code: Popover content
example.codeHighlighted: <button popovertarget="foo">Toggle the popover</button> <div id="foo" popover>Popover content</div>

resources.title: The Popover API (previously Popup) · Issue #743 · w3ctag/design-reviews · GitHub

example.codeHighlighted: <video src="video.mp4" controls></video>

example.code: Prices
example.codeHighlighted: <div id="tab1" aria-controls="panel1" role="tab">Prices</div> <div id="panel1" class="panel" aria-labelledby="tab1" role="tabpanel"> <!-- tab content --> </div>

entity.name: `<Fragment>`
entity.description: `<Fragment>`, often used via `<>...</>` syntax, lets you group elements without a wrapper node.
entity.descriptionHtml: <Fragment>, often used via <>...</> syntax, lets you group elements without a wrapper node.
entity.descriptionClean: Fragment, often used via .../ syntax, lets you group elements without a wrapper node.

entity.name: Web Share API
entity.description: Exposes a mechanism for sharing content to various user-selected targets.
entity.descriptionClean: Exposes a mechanism for sharing content to various user-selected targets.

example.codeHighlighted: navigator.share(shareData)

resources.title: Integrate with the OS sharing UI with the Web Share API

entity.name: Reinventing the wheel
entity.description: Constantly having to re-learn or re-implement the same concepts
entity.descriptionClean: Constantly having to re-learn or re-implement the same concepts

example.codeHighlighted: <canvas width="200" height="200"></canvas>
`let doc = new DOMParser().parseFromString(rawHTML, "text/html")`

resources.title: Smooth and simple transitions with the View Transitions API

entity.name: `inert` attribute
entity.description: Attribute to make an element and its descendants non-interactive, and invisible to assistive technology.
entity.descriptionClean: Attribute to make an element and its descendants non-interactive, and invisible to assistive technology.

example.codeHighlighted: <div id=app inert class=loading> ... </div>

resources.title: The "inert" attribute is finally coming to the web | Stefan Judis Web Development
User Preference Media Features Client Hints Headers
Improving user privacy and developer experience with User-Agent Client Hints - Chrome Developers

entity.name: `<dialog>`
entity.description: For dialog boxes or other interactive components, such as a dismissible alerts, or subwindows.
entity.descriptionClean: For dialog boxes or other interactive components, such as a dismissible alerts, or subwindows.

example.code:
<dialog id="confirm">
	<form method="dialog">
		Are you sure?
		<button value="1">Yes</button>
		<button value="0">No</button>
	</form>
</dialog>
example.codeHighlighted: <dialog id="confirm"> <form method="dialog"> Are you sure? <button value="1">Yes</button> <button value="0">No</button> </form> </dialog>
a:has(> img) { border: 2px solid grey; }
.parent { color: blue; .child { color: red; } }

entity.name: `<template>`
entity.description: A mechanism for holding HTML that is not to be rendered immediately but may be utilized later via JS.
entity.descriptionClean: A mechanism for holding HTML that is not to be rendered immediately but may be utilized later via JS.

example.codeHighlighted: <template id="counter"> <div class="counter">Clicked {{ times }} times</div> </template>

entity.name: `<selectlist>`
entity.descriptionClean: Stylable, customizable dropdown control. Previously selectmenu.

example.codeHighlighted: <selectlist> <option>Option 1</option> <option>Option 2</option> <option>Option 3</option> </selectlist>

resources.title: The selectmenu HTML Tag | CSS-Tricks - CSS-Tricks
Advanced Form Control Styling With Selectmenu And Anchoring API — Smashing Magazine

entity.name: Form validation
entity.description: Set of HTML attributes and JS APIs to facilitate client-side form validation (`<input pattern>`, `<input required>`, `input. setCustomValidity(msg)` etc)
entity.descriptionHtml: Set of HTML attributes and JS APIs to facilitate client-side form validation (<input pattern>, <input required>, input. setCustomValidity(msg) etc)
entity.descriptionClean: Set of HTML attributes and JS APIs to facilitate client-side form validation (input pattern, input required, input. setCustomValidity(msg) etc)

example.codeHighlighted: <input id="zip" pattern="[0-9]{5}" title="5 digits" required />

entity.name: Internationalization
entity.description: Issues with internationalizing, localizing, and translating content
entity.descriptionClean: Issues with internationalizing, localizing, and translating content

entity.name: Lazy loading
entity.description: Load certain resources only when needed.
entity.descriptionClean: Load certain resources only when needed.

example.codeHighlighted: <img src="picture.jpg" loading="lazy" /> <iframe src="supplementary.html" loading="lazy"></iframe>

resources.title: Browser-level image lazy loading for the web

entity.name: FormData API
entity.description: API to more easily extract and manipulate form data values via JS
entity.descriptionClean: API to more easily extract and manipulate form data values via JS

example.code:
let fd = new FormData(form);
let data = JSON.stringify(Object.fromEntries(fd));
example.codeHighlighted: let fd = new FormData(form); let data = JSON.stringify(Object.fromEntries(fd));

entity.name: `<details>` and `<summary>`
entity.description: A disclosure widget that can be toggled to hide or show content interactively.
entity.descriptionClean: A disclosure widget that can be toggled to hide or show content interactively.

class ClassWithPrivateField { #privateField }

entity.name: Content-Security Policy (CSP)
entity.description: An added layer of security that helps to detect and mitigate XSS and other attacks.
entity.descriptionClean: An added layer of security that helps to detect and mitigate XSS and other attacks.

example.codeHighlighted: Content-Security-Policy: default-src 'self'
<host-element> <template shadowrootmode="open"> <!-- Shadow content --> </template> </host-element>

resources.title: GitHub - mfreed7/declarative-shadow-dom: Declarative Shadow DOM feature development

example.codeHighlighted: :where(header, main, footer) p:hover { color: red; cursor: pointer; }
:root { --main-bg-color: brown; } .foo { background-color: var(--main-bg-color); }
<iframe src="https://example.com/"></iframe>

entity.name: Shadow DOM
entity.description: Encapsulate elements not visible from the outside, and style them with CSS not affecting the rest of the page.
entity.descriptionClean: Encapsulate elements not visible from the outside, and style them with CSS not affecting the rest of the page.

example.codeHighlighted: this.shadowRoot = this.attachShadow({mode: "open"});
